tv.generator-info-name: Processed by Open-EPG Visual Processor v1.0

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Ed and Rowena Waghorn continue to build a five bedroom house on an eight acre smallholding in Herefordshire, ten years in the making. Progress on the build was slow as Ed decided to do most of the work himself. (Final)

programme.title: Parkinson In Australia
programme.sub-title: 1980: Johnny Farnham, Bishop Howell Witt, Dennis Lillee
programme.desc: Come on a journey back to 1980 when Michael Parkinson interviews guests Johnny Farnham, Bishop Howell Witt and Dennis Lillee.
Two universities are accused of misleading and deceptive conduct after students discovered their degrees lacked professional accreditation. Plus Sarah Ferguson interviews actor Gary Oldman.

programme.title: ABC News Mornings
programme.desc: Stay in the know with whats happening this morning. ABC News brings you up-to-the-minute news to fuel your daily conversations so you can stay connected and follow the discussion across today. Presented by Kathryn Robinson.

programme.title: Back Roads
programme.desc: Kristy OBrien ventures to the tiny South Australian town of Lucindale, discovering a small community playing a big role in keeping the most colourful bush traditions alive.

programme.title: Brian Cox: Life Of A Universe
programme.desc: Professor Brian Cox probes our moment of creation. How did our Universe come into existence? Was there a time before the Big Bang? Do our laws of physics inexorably lead to the existence of us? (Part 1 of 2)

programme.title: Parliament Question Time
programme.desc: The sitting week in the House concludes with coverage of Question Time from the House of Representatives. Parliament resumes on Monday 27 October.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona and the team visit the impressive grounds of Brodie Castle in Moray.

programme.title: Hard Quiz
programme.desc: Tom Gleeson has a Big Brass Mug and to win it, contestants must answer Hard Quiz questions about ageing boyband the Backstreet Boys, the Pirates of the Caribbean movies, Australian wine, and Sir David Attenborough.

programme.title: Back Roads
programme.desc: Lisa Millar ventures to one of Tasmanias oldest and most celebrated woodchopping carnivals, Henley-on-Mersey. Its here she learns how generations of axemen and women are keeping this iconic Aussie sport alive. (Final)

programme.title: Mystery Road: Origin
programme.desc: Jay and Marys world is thrown into unimaginable horror when Anya goes missing. Jay goes rogue when he imprisoners a suspect.

programme.title: The Business
programme.desc: Australias leading daily business and finance show, bringing you up to date on market moves, economic trends and the forces affecting consumers, investors, employees and businesses big and small. Presented by Alicia Barry.

programme.title: Long Lost Family
programme.desc: In 1973, with no one to turn to, Ann gave up her firstborn son Mark, for adoption. And the story of 28-year-old nurse, Louise, searching for her father who she knows didnt want her.

programme.title: Parkinson In Australia
programme.sub-title: 1981: Clem Hawke, Bob Hawke, Diane Cilento, Connie Booth
programme.desc: Michael Parkinson interviews guests Clem Hawke, Bob Hawke, Diane Cilento and Connie Booth.

Sarah Ferguson presents Australias premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus analysis from 7.30s Political Editor Jacob Greber.

programme.title: ABC News Mornings
programme.desc: Stay in the know with whats happening this morning. ABC News brings you up-to-the-minute news to fuel your daily conversations so you can stay connected and follow the discussion across today. Presented by Kathryn Robinson.

programme.title: The Pacific
programme.desc: We look at how Palauans feel about the growing US militarisation of their islands, jump aboard a submarine conservation expedition in Fiji, and visit the Tongan-Australian choreographer taking the world by storm.

programme.title: ABC News At Noon
programme.desc: The leading news at lunchtime. Ros Childs brings you the days top stories and the latest news as it unfolds, with reporters in the community across Australia and around the world reporting on the issues that matter to you.

programme.title: Restoration Australia
programme.desc: Host Stuart Harrison meets a Perth couple who want to resurrect their adored family home that was lost to fire in 2015. But will they be able to rebuild the 1960s iconic modernist house as its original architect envisioned?

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: The roadshow goes to Belmont House in Kent, where treasures include a piece of HMS Bounty.

programme.title: Hard Quiz
programme.desc: The 200th episode of Hard Quiz is a Battle of the Duds! Tom Gleeson invites four failed contestants to humiliate themselves again. Vying for the Dud Mug are experts in The Phantom, Miles Davis, Easy Rider, and Adolf Hitler.

programme.title: Professor T
programme.desc: Professor T is asked to decipher a macabre puzzle when a doctor and her family are found dead in a grisly tableau on their living room sofa, each having died by different means...but in what order and at whose hands?

programme.title: The Assembly
programme.desc: Renowned interviewer, Leigh Sales mentors Autistic journalism students in The Assembly, and in this episode, the students interview journalist Ray Martin, with heart-warming results.

programme.title: Good Game Spawn Point
programme.sub-title: Minecraft Climate Warriors and Operation: Tango!
programme.desc: We team up to tango in the co-op spy thriller Operation: Tango, plus we check out Minecraft: Climate Warriors, an Aussie made project designed to teach us how to protect ourselves and our wildlife from natural disasters!

programme.title: We Bare Bears
programme.desc: A thunderstorm forces Chloe to spend the night at the bears cave. When Chloes parents tell the bears to make sure she stays safe, they go a bit overboard.

programme.title: Miraculous: Tales Of Ladybug And Cat Noir
programme.desc: When Malediktator comes back, now seconded by a Sentimonster, Ladybug entrusts a committed friend and ally with a Miraculous to help her save Paris.

programme.title: Odd Squad
programme.desc: Chaos ensues when one of Oscars Oscarbots malfunctions.

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: Shirleys snoring is keeping the flock awake, so Shaun decides that the only way to get a peaceful nights sleep is to get her out of the barn.

programme.title: Good Game Spawn Point
programme.sub-title: The Origins Of Rayman and Miitopia!
programme.desc: We find out the back story behind everyones favourite armless hero Rayman, plus we review the oddball adventure where you and your friends are the stars in Miitopia!

programme.title: We Bare Bears
programme.desc: A doctor tells the Bears to go on a cleanse to improve their health. But when Grizz realises he can only eat what grizzly bears eat, he starts to lose his mind.

programme.title: Miraculous: Tales Of Ladybug And Cat Noir
programme.desc: When Reflekta locks herself into a bottomless abyss of guilt, Ladybug calls on an ally with unfailing optimism.

programme.title: Odd Squad
programme.desc: When Agent Oris first day on the job turns into a worst-case scenario, other Odd Squad agents share their own worst first day ever stories.

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: When the Farmer decides to throw out his magic set, Shaun decides to put on a show - but things get out of hand when the flock start disappearing!

programme.title: BTN Newsbreak
programme.desc: Find out whats going on in the world with a news bulletin designed for children, featuring stories that are relevant and easy to understand.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: This show features an eclectic collection of home-made robots including Glitterbomb, designed by nine-year-old April. In a Robot Wars first, a team of students from Scotland bring a robot made of wood with a petrol engine.

programme.title: Dragon Ball Super
programme.desc: Goku continues to surprise Beerus with his growing powers. As their fight escalates, the universe manages to stay intact, but for how long? Then, Goku reverts back to a Super Saiyan! Have his godly powers run out?

programme.title: Traces
programme.desc: Another deadly explosion. Sarah and McKinvens growing attachment has fraught consequences, as Kathy suspects Jean the Dean of having a secret to hide.

programme.title: ABC News Update
programme.desc: The headlines from ABC News, updating you on the days top stories from across Australia and around the world.

programme.title: A Kind Of Spark
programme.desc: A trip to the big city leads to a shocking discovery about Maggies disappearance. Nina and Keedie build a shaky truce whilst party shopping.

programme.title: Dragon Ball Super
programme.sub-title: Show Us Goku! The Power Of A Super Saiyan God!
programme.desc: With the powers of a Super Saiyan God, Goku faces Beerus! Or, well he tries to. The immense power of a God takes a little getting used to but the longer he fights, the more Goku proves hes a real challenge.

programme.title: The Strange Chores
programme.desc: When Que invites the popular girls for a sleepover, everyone is working overtime to hide how weird her life really is.

programme.title: The Inbestigators
programme.sub-title: The Case Of The Puzzling Pet Day
programme.desc: When the Animal Shelter visits school to audition kids for a television commercial, Maudie suspects a crime is happening right under everyones noses.

programme.title: The Powerpuff Girls
programme.desc: When Bubbles gets the lead in the school play, Blossoms jealousy consumes her.

programme.title: Teen Titans Go!
programme.desc: In order to quickly get through their chores and karate lessons, the Titans learn how to montage.

programme.title: George Clarkes Amazing Spaces
programme.desc: George meets a couple in Manchester with an underground casino. George and Wills Texas road trip takes them to a home made from salvaged materials, as well as a caravan buried deep underground in case the apocalypse comes.

programme.title: Hard Quiz
programme.desc: Four contestants, one Big Brass Mug, and a host who takes no prisoners. Tom Gleeson tests his charges on their expert topics of Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles, the guillotine, the human circulatory system, and Olympic Swimming.

programme.title: Planet America
programme.desc: The government shutdown turns into a showdown over healthcare. Also, Trump advances plans to send troops into another American city, while the military destroys another drug-smuggling boat off the coast of Venezuela.

programme.title: My Family
programme.desc: Its Halloween and Susan enters enthusiastically into the spirit of trick or treat for the neighbourhood children, while Abi dons a somewhat unconventional costume. Ben tries to ignore it all, until the spirit gets him too.

programme.title: Before I Go To Sleep
programme.desc: A woman wakes up every day, remembering nothing, as a result of a traumatic accident in her past. One day, new terrifying truths emerge that force her to question everyone around her.

programme.title: A Kind Of Spark
programme.desc: Addies determined to make Nina and Keedies party the best ever, but when Emily blags a ticket the plan falls apart. Meanwhile a party in the 16th century puts Maggie in danger.

programme.title: Dragon Ball Super
programme.sub-title: Lets Keep Going Lord Beerus! The Battle Of Gods!
programme.desc: With his powers mostly under control, Goku ramps up the battle. But Beerus is still filled with unbelievable power and Goku takes hit after hit. Even though his injuries heal, can he handle the true strength of Beerus power?

programme.title: The Strange Chores
programme.desc: Charlie brings a musclebound future version of himself back to the present to train him for success. But Ques curious how he got so famous...

programme.title: The Inbestigators
programme.sub-title: The Case Of The Copy Cat
programme.desc: Ava is selected to deliver a speech at the town hall, but when she is accused of stealing it, Maudie must prove her innocence.

programme.title: The Powerpuff Girls
programme.desc: Buttercup takes her game winning mini golf ball, in spite of ominous warnings of dire consequences.

programme.title: Teen Titans Go!
programme.desc: Robin, Starfire, Cyborg, Beast Boy and Raven continue the fun with all-new adventures. More moments for what life is really like as a teen super hero once the cape comes off.

programme.title: Ransom
programme.desc: Multi-millionaire Tom Mullens son gets kidnapped, but when an FBI rescue operation goes awry, he turns the tables on the kidnappers by announcing on national television that the ransom money is now a bounty on their heads.

programme.title: My Family
programme.desc: With Nick juggling two girlfriends at once, Susan decides that Ben should spend more time with Michael for fear he might turn out like his brother. Plus, Janey has left baby Kenzo with the grandparents for the first time.

programme.title: Moon And Me
programme.desc: Mr Onion is very pleased that his best friend Dibillo wants to visit his bridge for tea. Mr Onion waits patiently for his best friend - but where is Dibillo?

programme.title: Beep And Mort
programme.desc: When Pop gets in the way of Beeps experiment, she finds herself on an exciting adventure involving fuzzles, flying and a swim in cake batter.

programme.title: Hoopla Doopla!
programme.desc: It is autumn in Hoopla and Jango is having trouble sweeping up all the leaves. So Bop turns Jangos vacuum cleaner into a leaf blower which accidentally blows leaves and dirt all over Jangos friends.

programme.title: The Sound Collector
programme.desc: Camping outside for the night the Sound Collector has several visitors he didnt expect!

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: Sula, Pando, Flop and Padget all have a knack, a special thing that only they can do. Bing is frustrated when all his own knacks are easy for everyone else to do too.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppas playgroup is holding a jumble sale. Madame Gazelle asks everyone to bring something to sell. Peppa, and each of her friends, bring in an old toy but they soon realise that favourite toys can be hard to let go of.

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: The Farmer has a thrilling new hobby - however its not as easy as it looks! When the Farmer gets stuck in a tree Bitzer comes to his rescue, leaving Shaun and the Flock to get to grips with the airborne contraption.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Sarah puts on a captivating lunchtime theatre show outside the Wholefish Cafe. Its so good that Charlie doesnt notice his stove burst into flames

programme.title: Ben And Hollys Little Kingdom
programme.desc: Things are going missing all over the Little Kingdom - Holly has lost her wand and Ben has lost his horn! Soon they realise that ants are stealing their things, and try to persuade the Queen Ant to give them back.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: The children decorate the clubhouse to make it scary for Halloween but not too scary. The kids give the grownups a tour and thy pretend to be scared but the kids reassure them its not too scary.

programme.title: Ginger And The Vegesaurs
programme.desc: Gingers tells the Pea-Rexes that she has a delicious treat for them - a hearty breakfast of yummy drops except there is a twist. Ginger has hidden the drops and they have to go on a treasure hunt to find them!

programme.title: Super Monsters
programme.desc: Spike learns the joy of teamwork and friendship during a scavenger hunt.

programme.title: Nikhil and Jay
programme.sub-title: Nikhil and Jay and the Alien Elephants
programme.desc: When Nikhil and Jay find a tiny elephant, they have very different ideas about what to do with it; Jay wants it to play alien spaceships and Nikhil wants it to go into his museum.

programme.title: Ready Eddie Go!
programme.desc: Eddie visits the doctor to understand why he feels unwell and learns how to take his medicine properly.

programme.title: Play School Science Time
programme.desc: Ever wondered why objects cast shadows? Luke is bringing to light some interesting findings through shadow play, as he experiments with simple objects and a torch to better understand the science behind shadows.

programme.title: Ready, Steady, Wiggle!
programme.desc: Join Anthony and Lucia in the Wiggly Kitchen, what will they find today? Its then time for some finger play fun with This Little Piggy then the Dancing Water Police of Wiggle Town are here to help!

programme.title: Alphablocks
programme.desc: OO and friends help a magical talking book tell the story of Little Red Riding Hood. This episode introduces the OO letter team and the words book, hood, cool, moon, woof, good, boot, cook and food.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa tries to prove to Suzy Sheep that she is not a chatterbox, but staying quiet is harder than it sounds.

programme.title: Millie Magnificent
programme.desc: In order to cheer up Dax, Millie and her pals decide to find a new instrument for him to play while his fiddle is getting fixed.

programme.title: Stan Can
programme.desc: Stanley helps Little Woo fly their kite on a windy day.

programme.title: Kangaroo Beach
programme.desc: Things get out of hand when Nevilles plan for a peaceful day of floating on the river turns into a wild race.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Nia is bringing a new animal to Sodor Animal Park... but its an elephant that doesnt like steam engines!

programme.title: Gardening Australia Junior
programme.desc: Tammy and Luca learn the importance of water when gardening and make a portable water lily pond.

programme.title: Wiggle And Learn
programme.desc: Come with John and the rest of The Wiggles as they take you on a journey through the colours of the rainbow!

programme.title: Ariel
programme.desc: Fernie makes a new friend.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and George go to play with Cousin Chloe and her friends, but he older children dont want to play any "baby" games.

programme.title: Octonauts: Above And Beyond
programme.desc: When some baby Longfin Eels go missing, Koshi, Dashi, and Shellington conduct a thorough investigation to figure out what set them off course from their migration route.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: When its Bingos turn to bring her Kindys Bob Bilby puppet home and record their weekend in the scrapbook, the family resolve to put down their screens and show him a good time.

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: Duggee and the squirrels had a great adventure outside and want to tell everyone about it. What better way to tell a story than through a Puppet Show! First they make the puppets. Scissors! Card! Glue! Glitter! Feathers!

programme.title: Supertato
programme.desc: Evil Pea blows all the lanterns away during the Lantern Festival. Supertato struggles to get them all back and needs Broccolis help to save the day.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: On Bingo and Blueys Rug Island, a pack of felt pens can be anything - bananas, campfires, even a snake! But Dad will need to embrace his inner kid if he wants to make it his home.

programme.title: Moon And Me
programme.desc: Colly Wobbles friends give her special things to pack in her toy suitcase. Colly Wobble takes her suitcase on a journey in storyland, and each time she opens the suitcase, the special things make her think of her friends.

programme.title: Beep And Mort
programme.desc: A button with magic abilities causes mayhem for Mort, who struggles to keep control of his strange and exciting new powers.

programme.title: Hoopla Doopla!
programme.desc: Squidgie wants to take photos of all her friends to hang on the walls of Mimis cafe. So she borrows Ziggys camera, but taking photos isnt easy.

programme.title: The Sound Collector
programme.desc: The Sound Collector is recording snores today as he makes an early morning outing.

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: Sula and Bing tag their favourite things around the house with heart shaped stickies. Sometimes they have different favourites and sometimes their favourite things are the same. But when Sula tags Hoppity Voosh, Bing is upset.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and her family are at the swimming pool. George is a little worried at first but is soon splashing happily. Everyone is surprised to discover that Daddy is very good at swimming and diving.

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: Its bedtime for Timmy but hes overtired and wont go to sleep. Nothing seems to calm him until Shaun accidentally makes a shadow puppet on the wall. Eureka! Theyll put on a puppet show to help Timmy go to sleep!

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Sarah puts on a captivating lunchtime theatre show outside the Wholefish Cafe. Its so good that Charlie doesnt notice his stove burst into flames

programme.title: Ben And Hollys Little Kingdom
programme.desc: Barnaby Elfs uncle, Redbeard the Elf Pirate, comes to visit the Little Kingdom, but he has lost his treasure. Holly, Ben, the Fairies and the Elves must help Redbeard follow the clues to track down the treasure.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and her friends are playing in their Club House. They decide to set up a detective club and when Daddy Pig loses his car key they have a real mystery to solve.

programme.title: Kangaroo Beach
programme.desc: When Pounce competes against Reef and Roadie in a jumping contest, his friends worry hes putting himself in danger.

programme.title: Super Monsters
programme.desc: The Super Monsters help Katya cure her witchy-ups, showing the power of teamwork and creativity.

programme.title: Nikhil and Jay
programme.sub-title: Nikhil and Jay and the Monsooooooon!
programme.desc: Nikhil and Jay want to be in the monsoon rain. But its not raining...and they dont just want rain, rain, they want MONSOON rain, like their Chennai Grandparents have.

programme.title: Ready Eddie Go!
programme.desc: Eddie learns all steps of making pancakes from finding the kitchen equipment to the best part: dressing and eating.

programme.title: Play School Science Time
programme.desc: How can air cause movement? Rachael is learning about how air can apply force and cause movement in the Science Time lab, using household items to make a wind-powered car!

programme.title: Ready, Steady, Wiggle!
programme.desc: Simon and Evie find a pair of glasses in the Wiggly Kitchen and they dont know what to do with them. The Tree of Wisdom is here to help! Sing along and learn the alphabet with the ABC Alphabet Song.

programme.title: Alphablocks
programme.desc: M is very hungry so his friends make a gingerbread man - but can he catch it? This episode introduces the letter M and the words mat, map and man.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and George go to play with Cousin Chloe and her friends, but he older children dont want to play any "baby" games.

programme.title: Millie Magnificent
programme.desc: When Millie and her pals decide to camp out, they worry theres a monster in the yard.

programme.title: Stan Can
programme.desc: Stanley helps Hattie make a cake and gather the ingredients through unconventional means.

programme.title: Kangaroo Beach
programme.desc: When Pounce competes against Reef and Roadie in a jumping contest, his friends worry hes putting himself in danger.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: When Rebecca tells James he could be a comic-book super-engine, he takes her seriously, and Rail Rocket is born.

programme.title: Gardening Australia Junior
programme.desc: Tammy and the junior gardeners create the ultimate dinosaur backyard garden paradise, rawwwr!

programme.title: Wiggle And Learn
programme.desc: Join The Wiggles in the magical world of dolls! Sing along to Miss Polly had a Dolly with Sahara Beck and join Simon for a whimsical Dolls and Fairies Parade.

programme.title: Ariel
programme.desc: Ariel and Triton spend Daddy Daughter Adventure Day together.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and her family collect apples and blackberries in Granny and Grandpa Pigs garden to make a pie.

programme.title: Octonauts: Above And Beyond
programme.desc: When Paani finds a frog who fears he may be the last of his kind, the Octonauts use the new Terra-Gup 4 to search for his family.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: When Bingo stops playing Blueys spy game in the park, their device to control the grown-ups stops working properly! Bluey now sees how important Bingo is and needs to win her back!

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: Duggee is using his trusty binoculars to do some bird-watching, and of course, the squirrels want to have a go too. The problem is, if you want to go bird watching you have to be very quiet otherwise the birds will fly away.

programme.title: Supertato
programme.desc: Supertato shows the Grape Kids how to camp Supertato-style, but Evil Pea arrives and wows them with her ice camping. Before long, the Grape Kids need to be rescued by Supertato.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: Bluey and Bingo want everyone to play Charades, but Muffin and Socks are too young to understand the rules and Nanna must think quickly to keep the game on track.

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Ed and Rowena Waghorn continue to build a five bedroom house on an eight acre smallholding in Herefordshire, ten years in the making. Progress on the build was slow as Ed decided to do most of the work himself. (Final)

programme.title: ABC Late News
programme.desc: Know the latest on the days top stories, as Craig Smart brings you a comprehensive roundup of the news of the day. ABC News has reporters across Australia and around the globe reporting on the issues that matter to you.

programme.title: ABC Late News
programme.desc: Follow the latest on todays news, covering whats happening and why it matters. ABC News has reporters across Australia and around the globe to bring you the news you need to know. Presented by Craig Smart in Perth.

programme.title: Creative Types With Virginia Trioli
programme.desc: George Miller is a genuine Australian visionary and is recognised as one of the greatest action film directors of all time. Hes a philosopher, an innovator and a storyteller - and hes not done with Mad Max yet.

programme.title: DW News
programme.desc: The latest international news and the days top stories from a European perspective. Our broadcast partner DW brings you live coverage from Berlin with updated reports and expert analysis on the big global issues and events.

programme.title: The World

programme.desc: The sitting week in the House concludes with live coverage of Question Time from the House of Representatives. Parliament resumes on Monday 27 October.
